A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This may be the longest Star Wars movie in the saga\, and 2.5 hours sounds like a long time on paper. But in actuality\, the time sure flew by.\nFrom beginning to end\, my dad - who has only watched the original trilogy and is a casual fan at best - and I - who have watched both the prequels and the sequels and avidly followed the Expanded-Universe/Legends before it was retired - were glued to our seats. The film managed to strike a fine balance between character development and propulsive action\, and in a rare feat\, also managed to honor the saga's past while forging new paths forward. While I enjoyed the \"Force Awakens\" two years ago\, it is only now that I am truly excited about seeing the future of \"Star Wars.\"
